availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Vance (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Fugitive from justice.)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Richard Vance, Sr., and Mary Vance. Married to Sarah R. Lampkin Vance. Father of Mary E. Vance, James Lee Vance, Sarah J. Vance, and William Grant Vance. Farmer in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860. Indicted for horse stealing in Hart Circuit Court in 1865. Fugitive from justice in Indiana in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 196B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 835.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Powder Mill District, p. 372B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Hart County Births.
KYR-0001-006-0059.
